title: What is World Teachers' Day which is celebrated in the Google Doodle?
text:
She’s not like a regular teacher, she’s a cool teacher. (Picture: REX)

On October 5th, he asked what day it is.

It’s October 5th, World Teachers’ Day.

Ok, not quite as catchy as Mean Girls Day, but Tina Fey’s Mrs Norbury was really a stand-out in that movie and teachers like her deserve to be celebrated.

Here’s what you need to know about World Teacher’s Day and why it’s the subject of today’s Google Doodle.

What is World Teachers’ Day?

The day, also known as International Teachers Day, is held every year on 5 October.

The day was first held on 5 October, 1994, to commemorate the ILO/Unesco Recommendation concerning the Status of Teachers.

This recommendation focused on setting a standard for the work lives of teachers all over the world.

This year’s World Teachers’ Day has a theme of ‘Young Teachers: The future of the Profession.’

How is Google Doodle celebrating Teachers’ Day 2019?

Google is getting in on the celebrations, with one of their fun Google Doodles.

Today’s Doodle shows a multitasking octopus teaching a class of fish.

Google celebrates teachers all across the globe today (Picture: Metro)

It uses its number of legs to juggle the busy workload of a teacher – taking in work, wiping the board and passing chalk to a student.

Many teachers would love having eight arms some days, most likely.

Celebrities who’ve been teachers

Teaching is such an important profession, and before they got famous, some familiar faces used to inspire young minds.

Her teaching days were probably less stressful than the Hogwarts professors’ (Picture: Rex Features)

J.K. Rowling

The mastermind behind one of the biggest British institutions since Bond, Rowling responded to an ad and ended up teaching English at Porto, Portugal before writing her spellbinding novels.

Would you dare to forget your homework for Mr Neeson? (Picture: SIPA USA)

Liam Neeson

As most of his films show, Liam Neeson is not one to mess with. And it turns out this was always the case – he trained to become a teacher but ultimately quit to pursue other options after decking a student.

He told the story to ESPN, saying: ‘This particular kid did not want to settle down, he wanted to disrupt the whole class. So I went over to him and asked him to leave the classroom and stand outside. The next thing he pulled a knife on me. My reaction was to punch him, which I shouldn’t have done but I felt threatened.’

Hot for teacher (Picture: Rex Features)

Hugh Jackman

The Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman was also a great P.E. teacher in Uppingham.

He even remembered one of his former students mid-interview in 2013.

Parents evening would be more fun (Picture: Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images)

Gene Simmons

The KISS frontman Gene Simmons could’ve been like a real life School of Rock Jack Black.

He taught sixth Grade in Harlem for six months while the band was forming.

Face paint probably is against dress code policy so he definitely made a smart decision.

He’d be a strict teacher. Every breath you take, he’ll be watching you. (Picture: David M. Benett/Dave Benett/Getty Images)

Sting

Police frontman, Sting, was a qualified primary school teacher.
